s.text: Choate tells the LAT that Ross Perot has decided not to run, but the Post still speculates that Perot might jump in.

A front-page LAT piece on the alleged Bank of New York money-laundering scandal argues that much of the suspicious Russian money is owned by legitimate Russian businessmen who simply do not trust Russian banks or wish to avoid paying excessive taxes to a corrupt government.

Buchanan, a former speechwriter for Barry Goldwater, Richard Nixon, and Ronald Reagan, urged his supporters to "save our republic before she disappears into the godless New World Order that the elites are constructing in a betrayal of everything for which our Founding Fathers lived, fought and died."
Once a tight-knit but downtrodden blue-collar community, the hometown of Bruce Springsteen has become a wealthy, yuppified commercial district, with lots of jobs, high taxes, and a fleet of SUVs.
Air Force F-16s tracking the plane could only watch as it flew on autopilot for over 1,000 miles, ran out of fuel, and plunged into a South Dakota swamp.
